intro: Souroubea suaveolens, commonly known as the sweet-scented souroubea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and emit a pleasant fragrance when crushed.
